title: Frame rate is TERRIBLE after 6.15
body:
So I've been playing league on my recently built gaming pc for a while now, and right as I downloaded 6.15 I've been experiencing some frustrating issues that have to do with the frame rate in game. I have an AMD RX 480, Core i-5 quad-core processor, running on windows 10 64-bit. Now you may be wondering, what is this guys problem he has a sweet setup, well, when i first downloaded the patch the frame rate has been really wonky. If i leave it uncapped, it goes to like 440fps my character teleport around as i try to move back and forth in a fast way. So I capped it at 80 to see if it would fix it, it did. Once the patch came out, however, even if i leave the fps uncapped, the game will still perform at 30fps or lower. The number on screen stays at either whatever i cap it at goes higher if i leave it uncapped. Last night i tried to restart my computer to see if that would fix it, it did, for about 3 minutes. This has been very frustrating because if has been severely affecting my play becasue the screen has a really bad delay from when i move my mouse to when the screen moves (it also doesnt help im playing on a tv instead of a monitor). I've done everything, followed directions from the league support page, repaired, even uninstalled and reinstalled but nothing is working. If any of you are having similar and found a solution please tell me so i can finally get back to playing league. Thank you!

TLDR; After 6.15 my fps on screen says its at whatever i cap it at like 60, 80, 100, etc. but its actually performing at 30 fps or lower, I've done everything including repair, uninstall and reinstall, and followed all the directions on the riot support page, please if you have a solution tell me, Thanks!

Edit: So it turns out I actually wasnt running most of my games in 60 fps, when I first build my pc, the edges of the screen were not matching the actual edge on my monitor, so I used the AMD settings and turned HDMI scaling to 5% to fit the edges of the screen. This was what was preventing me from running some games in 60fps. So I switched it to 0% and the edges didnt fit again, but my tv has a way to change the aspect of it from normal, wide, zoom, so I put it at full 100% setting and it fixed all my fps problems in all my games. I'm sorry but I wasn't having the same problems as you guys, I don't know the solution if this doesn't fix it for you :(

replies.body:
Hey, 

I had the exact same issue after updating to 6.15. It would cap to 60fps regardless of setting but would actually feel way lower then is. 
I tried reinstalling several times but it did not work.
So I tried to changed the compatibility to windows 7 and had normal fps again.
Is it in the league settings or is it a setting in windows itself? Sorry, kind of a noob to pc gaming, build my first one a few weeks ago
Right click on your league icon , go to properties then compatibility, Run this program in compatibility mode and select windows 7

Still running in less than 30fps even though it says 120, starting to not want to play the game anymore, its almost impossible to play in 30 fps when over 90% of your opponents are at a severe frame rate advantage

Edit: so when I did the compatibility thing it didn't do anything, still the number on screen was high but the fps was well under 60, then i tried uninstalling and it didn't work, do you think it's a problem with my pc? because im able to run Evolve, Skyrim, and TF2 in 60 fps with no issues at all. Let me try to reset my pc becasue that worked for me for like a few mins so ill try that now.

> [{quoted}](name=ForesTrump,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=TTrIw26l,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-04T19:16:54.816+0000)
>
> Still running in less than 30fps even though it says 120, starting to not want to play the game anymore, its almost impossible to play in 30 fps when over 90% of your opponents are at a severe frame rate advantage
> 
> Edit: so when I did the compatibility thing it didn't do anything, still the number on screen was high but the fps was well under 60, then i tried uninstalling and it didn't work, do you think it's a problem with my pc? because im able to run Evolve, Skyrim, and TF2 in 60 fps with no issues at all. Let me try to reset my pc becasue that worked for me for like a few mins so ill try that now.

Hi ForesTrump; ive been having the same issue. I don't have a high end machine, but i can actually play the game at +60 FPS. These days, i can barely see 30 FPS, i mean, it goes down to 1, 2 or even 0 FPS at the point it's impossible to play, and in top of that, it stutters and freezes my screen :(

Thanks for the troubleshooting so far and trying the support page article.  If the[ FPS issues ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting)guide hasn't helped, we'd like to take a closer look.  Reach out to our tech team by submitting a[ support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  Also, gather a set of logs to give us some more context by using the[ hextech repair tool ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs)and attach it to your ticket.  Thanks for your patience; you'll be in good hands!

So I sent in a support ticket to your page with all the info given, but its almost been 3 days and still nothing. does it normally take this long? And what would you do to help me? I can not find the issue and I dont think you guys can fix it without a patch or something.

> [{quoted}](name=ForesTrump,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=TTrIw26l,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2016-08-07T06:58:52.724+0000)
>
> So I sent in a support ticket to your page with all the info given, but its almost been 3 days and still nothing. does it normally take this long? And what would you do to help me? I can not find the issue and I dont think you guys can fix it without a patch or something.

Ive been waiting 3 days as well T.T I hope a patch can really fix this man.

So I think something may have had to do with in game settings because once I reset everything to default, it changed the resolution and it was at the normal 60 fps+, and i just put the resolution back to 1920x1080 and it magically started to run a 60 fps again. Hopefully it stays at the 120 fps i have it capped at

Edit: later on that day it went back to the same issue as before, I submitted a support ticked last night, but it has yet to be opened, i guess ill be waiting on that

I'm going through the same exact thing, i usually get around 120 FPS, but recently I've been lucky to get 30. In teamfights i get around 10. I've lowered my video quality settings to "Very Low," yet it doesn't do a thing. I was thinking it could be the new project minions, but I cant really say. Have you solved the issue? Like what did you do to help it? Thanks

I seriously do not know what the issue is. I wish I had a solution, but I cant figure out what it is. Another weird thing thats happening is if I change the resolution, it just goes back to the fps I'm normally at, but obviously it isn't the right resolution so it looks horrible. What is also weird is that the recommended resolution is something like 3260x2000 ish or something. But still the recommended resolution isn't 1920x1080, which is what my monitor is using. Whenever I turn my computer on after resetting or waking it up from sleep mode, League runs at the same fps it was before the patch, it works at the desired fps for about 2-4 matches depending how long they are then just goes back to 30.

> [{quoted}](name=DGChrisman,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=TTrIw26l,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-08-04T17:22:41.846+0000)

Do you have radeon chill enabled? If yes disable it while playing. Default hotkey is F11
